questions.question: What is the full form of RAM?
What is the difference between RAM and ROM?
options: ROM is permanent storage while RAM is volatile storage
RAM is permanent storage while ROM is volatile storage
ROM is volatile storage while RAM is permanent storage
RAM is volatile storage while ROM is permanent storage
questions.correct_answer: ROM is permanent storage while RAM is volatile storage

questions.question: What is the difference between TCP and UDP?
options: TCP is connection-oriented while UDP is connectionless
TCP is connectionless while UDP is connection-oriented
TCP is reliable while UDP is unreliable
UDP is reliable while TCP is unreliable
questions.correct_answer: TCP is connection-oriented while UDP is connectionless

questions.question: What is the purpose of a firewall?
options: To protect a network from unauthorized access
To protect a network from authorized access
To protect a network from malicious software
To protect a network from legitimate software
questions.correct_answer: To protect a network from unauthorized access

questions.question: What is the main purpose of the speaker?
What is the main idea of the passage?
options: The history of the United States

questions.question: What is the best way to start a persuasive essay?
options: With a definition of the term

questions.question: What is the best way to end a speech?
What is the difference between a fact and an opinion?
options: A fact is something that is true
An opinion is something that is true
A fact is something that is not true
An opinion is something that is not true
questions.correct_answer: A fact is something that is true

questions.question: What is the main difference between fiction and nonfiction?
What is the best way to organize your writing?
options: With a definition of the term

How do you manage the uncertainty of change?

options: Ignore them and hope they go away

questions.question: What is the best way to learn new skills?
How do you stay up-to-date on your field?

Which of the following is a technique to prioritize tasks?
(A) Critical path method
(B) Pareto principle
(C) Both A and B
(D) None of the above
questions.category: Prioritization tasks and setting clear goals.

questions.question:
Which of the following is NOT a part of the project life cycle?
(A) Initiation
(B) Execution
(C) Testing
(D) Closure
questions.category: Understanding project life cycles, from initiation to completion.

(A) Microsoft Project
(B) Trello
(C) Google Sheets
(D) Adobe Photoshop

questions.question:
Which of the following is NOT a good estimation technique for task duration?
(A) Analogy
(B) Parametric
(C) Monte Carlo simulation
(D) Delphi method
questions.category: Estimation of time required for tasks and setting deadlines.

questions.question:
When handling multiple assignments, which of the following techniques is NOT recommended?
(A) Break down large tasks into smaller ones
(B) Work on the most important tasks first
(C) Schedule time for each task
(D) Multitask as much as possible
questions.category: Handling multitasking and managing multiple assignments.

questions.question:
How can you set clear goals for a project?
(A) By defining the purpose of the project
(B) By defining the scope of the project
(C) Both A and B
(D) None of the above
questions.category: Prioritization tasks and setting clear goals.

questions.question:
Which of the following is NOT a good practice for setting deadlines?
(A) Set deadlines that are too ambitious
(B) Set deadlines that are too lenient
(C) Communicate deadlines to all stakeholders
(D) Review deadlines regularly
questions.category: Estimation of time required for tasks and setting deadlines.

questions.question:
Which of the following is NOT a good technique for handling multitasking?
(A) Break down large tasks into smaller ones
(B) Work on the most important tasks first
(C) Schedule time for each task
(D) Multitask as much as possible
questions.category: Handling multitasking and managing multiple assignments.

(A) Initiation

(D) Closure

questions.question: You are a manager and you are interviewing a candidate for a technical position. The candidate is 10 minutes late for the interview. What should you do?
options: Apologize for the wait and ask the candidate to start their presentation.
Ask the candidate to wait outside until you are ready.
questions.correct_answer: Apologize for the wait and ask the candidate to start their presentation.

questions.question: You are a job seeker and you have been invited to a mock interview session on our Platform. What should you do before the session?
questions.category: Setting up Mock interview sessions on our Platform
options: Review the interview rubric and practice answering the questions.
Set up an alarm to remind yourself of the interview time.
Dress professionally and arrive on time for the session.

questions.question: You are interviewing for a job and the interviewer asks you, "Why should we hire you?" What should you say?
options: I am a hard worker and I am always willing to learn new things.
I am a team player and I am always willing to help others.
I am a quick learner and I am always up for a challenge.

questions.question: You are setting up a mock interview session on our Platform. What should you do?
questions.category: Setting up Mock interview sessions on our Platform
options: Choose a topic for the interview.
Set up a time and date for the interview.
Invite the candidate to the interview.
